page.topic: Drag and Drop File Upload Control

description.p: The Drag and Drop File Upload Control (Drag and Drop Control) adds the ability to upload files by dragging and dropping files from the filesystem onto a designated location in your app. When the files are dropped, Alpha Anywhere uploads the files to the the specified location -- either Amazon S3 or the Alpha Anywhere Application Server.

In addition to drag and drop, this control also supports tapping or clicking the drag and drop area to open a File picker to select files from the device for upload. See [Click on Drag and Drop area to select files] below for more details.

section.title: Adding the Drag and Drop File Upload Control

description.p: To add drag and drop file upload to a component, add a *[ui:Drag&DropArea]* control to your UX component.
Next, click on the smart field to configure the *[ui:Drag and Drop area properties]* and *[ui:File upload properties]* for the control:

The vertical and horizontal alignment of the text

section.title: Configuring the Drag and Drop Area

description.p: The drag and drop area is the area where uses can drop files for upload. You can customize the look and feel of the drag and drop area with the *[ui:Drag and Drop area properites]*. These properties include:
The text shown in the drag and drop area where files can be dropped. This text should suggest what the user should do.
Default message is "Drag one or more files here to upload."
The veritcal position of the text shown in the drag and drop area. The message can be positioned *[ui:Top]*, *[ui:Center]*, or *[ui:Bottom]*.
Default value is *[ui:Center]*.
The horizontal position of the text shown in the drag and drop area. The message can be positioned *[ui:Left]*, *[ui:Center]*, or *[ui:Right]*.
Default value is *[ui:Center]*.
Inline CSS styling applied to the drag and drop area. The CSS specified here will override any style information definined in classes assigned to this control.
Default style is:
One or more CSS classes containing styling information for the drag and drop area.
Default value is blank.

case.title: Click on Drag and Drop area to select files

description.p: If checked, the user can click on the drag and drop area to open a file picker to select one or more files to upload in addition to dragging and dropping files on the control.
By default, this property is unchecked.
The *[ui:File upload properties]* specify where files will be stored when they are uploaded. Files can be stored on the Alpha Anywhere Application Server or Amazon S3.

File Upload settings are identical to those specified in the File Upload - Amazon S3 Storage or Alpha Anywhere Action Javascript action. See [File Upload - Amazon S3 Storage or Alpha Anywhere] for more information about specific upload properties.
The Drag and Drop control has the following properties:

case.title: Control Id
case.description: The Drag and Drop control's Id. This id can be used with the *[js:{dialog.object}.getPointer()]* method to get a pointer to the HTML DOM Element for the Drag and Drop control.

case.title: Drag and Drop area properties
case.description: Settings for configuring the look and feel of the drag and drop area. See [Configuring the Drag and Drop Area] above for more information.

case.title: File upload properties
case.description: File upload properties property. See [File Upload - Amazon S3 Storage or Alpha Anywhere] for more information.

case.title: Width
case.description: Specify the control width. Use CSS syntax for the width (e.g. 100px, 100%, etc.)

case.title: Height
case.description: Specify the control height. Use CSS syntax (but not %) for the width (e.g. 100px, etc.). TIP: It is generally not necessary to set the height of a ControlBar as it is computed automatically.

case.title: Break
case.description: Force a column break before, after, or both before and after this control.

case.title: Break height
case.description: Specify the vertical distance between this control and the next control. Use CSS syntax. e.g. 10px, .5in, 20pt.

case.title: Horizontal spacer
case.description: Specify the horizontal space between this control and the next control. Use CSS syntax. e.g. 10px, .5in, 20pt.

case.title: Horizontal spacer
case.description: Specify the horizontal space between this control and the next control. Use CSS syntax. e.g. 10px, .5in, 20pt.

case.title: Control container class name
case.description: Controls in a UX Component are wrapped in a DIV with the class 'A5CWLayout' or 'A5container', unless the has been placed in a 'NoFloat' or 'Alignment' container. The *[ui:Control container class name]* allows you to add one or more additional CSS classes to the DIV for the Drag and Drop control.

case.title: Control container prevent float
case.description: The class applied to the DIV wrapped around the Drag and Drop control applies a 'float' to the control so that controls render automatically from left to right until a control with a 'break after' is encountered. The class used to apply the float includes a fixed width padding. If you do not want the padding or float behavior applied to the Drag and Drop control, check the *[ui:Control container prevent flaot]* property to prevent the class (either 'A5CWLayout' or 'A5container') from being assigned to the DIV wrapper for this control.

description.p: The Drag and Drop control has no methods or properties. It is not a data control, so UX methods such as *[js:{dialog.object}.getValue()]* and *[js:{dialog.object}.setValue()]* cannot be used with the control.
